chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

result.execSummary:
The defendant Ouneheuane Saypanya was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs over the duration of probation failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges over the duration of probation or, if not paid, a civil judgment is ordered.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
No contact with children under the age of 18.  Defendant to undergo a sex offender evaluation and complete training. NO CONTACT ORDER REMAINS.

records.addlTxt: Filed, Justice Point Report dated 9/11/2015.
Bail Refund Check Packet
8/13/15 bail refund notice/affidavit mailed to surety.

Defendant Ouneheuane Saypanya in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 10 YEARS, with credit for 5 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".
The Court STAYED this sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 5 YEARS with the following conditions:  
Serve 1 YEAR in the House of Correction with huber for work. Defendant has a report date of 8.17.15 before 
12 pm.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs over the duration of probation failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
No contact with children under the age of 18.  Defendant to undergo a sex offender evaluation and complete training. NO CONTACT ORDER REMAINS.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges over the duration of probation or, if not paid, a civil judgment is ordered.Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Sentencing Referral Form.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Plea hearing proceeded. Defendant sworn in.

As to COUNT 1 as AMENDED-
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead NO CONTEST.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing and pay a DNA surcharge.

Court advised the defendant that upon a conviction of this offense he may be subject to Chapter 980 proceedings.
Court advised the defendant of the sex offender registry requirements.

Court vacated the jury trial date of 8/05/15. 
Parties request an adjourned sentencing date. Court granted joint request. Parties advised as of August 1, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Thomas McAdams,  Branch 07, Room 620 of the Safety Building. Case adjourned to Branch 25.

Defendant Ouneheuane Saypanya in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for final pretrial. State withdrew the Other Acts motion previously filed on 5/28/15. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. State placed negotiations on the record. State filed an Amended Information. Defendant charged as follows:

COUNT 1- Third Degree Sexual Assault, contrary to sec. 940.225(3), 939.50(3)(g) Wis. Stats., a Class G Felony.

Defense counsel acknowledged receipt of the amended information and waived formal reading.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Defense Memorandum Opposing State's Motion To Admit Other Acts Evidence

Scheduling Order signed and filed. The Court will allow the Defense until July 20, 2015 at close of business to file its response to the State's request. Copy of order sent to ADA Shomin and attorney Pecora. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
FILED, MOTION FOR EXTENSION OF DEADLINE TO FILE DEFENSE RESPONSE TO OTHER ACTS MOTIONS AND DEMAND FOR ADDITIONAL DISCOVERY
Motion to admit prior conviction/prior acts from the defense received and filed.

Defendant Ouneheuane Saypanya in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel requests final pretrial and jury trial dates. Parties to file motions by 6/05/15. Any motions requiring testimony will be heard on the final pretrial date. Parties to file witness lists, jury instructions, and motions in limine by the final pretrial date. State to file proposed verdict forms and substantive jury instructions by the final pretrial date. Defense will be filing a Schiffra motion. Parties advised as of 08/01/15 this matter will be assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 07 in Room 620 of the Safety Building. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Justice Point report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Ouneheuane Saypanya in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel just received discovery but has not received an offer from the State. Defense requests an adjourned scheduling date. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Ouneheuane Saypanya in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora. David Behm on behalf of Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 25.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed. tk

Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Ouneheuane Saypanya in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant Ouneheuane Saypanya in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.
